TITLE: I'm Proud
SONGCREDIT: "I'm Proud" from the album Rise Shine #Woke by Alphabet Rockers. ℗ & © 2017 by School Time Music LLC. Used by permission of School Time Music LLC. All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: ¡Sabes que es momento de pararse! ¡A cantar fuerte!Estoy orgulloso de ser quien soy y de ser un buen amigo, tengo que saber que tú eres tú y yo soy yo,y juntos podemos comprender que hay más para nosotrosque lo que tú ves, escuchaacá y ahora mismo verás.Tengo el poder,tengo la fortaleza,tengo el amor de los que estuvieron antes que yo y me hicieron quien soy.Tengo el coraje, tengo el impulso,tengo la magia que se forma dentro de mí, me hace quien soy.COROMira a la izquierda y grita: MIRA, ESTOY ORGULLOSO. Mira a la derecha y grita: MIRA, ESTOY ORGULLOSO. Mira a la multitud y grita: MIRA, ESTOY ORGULLOSO. Nunca bajes la mirada porque vivimos a lo grande.Mira a la izquierda y grita: MIRA, ESTOY ORGULLOSO. Mira a la derecha y grita: MIRA, ESTOY ORGULLOSO. Mira a la multitud y grita: MIRA, ESTOY ORGULLOSO Nunca bajes la mirada, ¡porque vivimos a lo grande!Es fácil ser yo,pero solo cuando tú me ves y me dejas ser quien se supone que sea,una estrella en ascenso, un corazón abierto.Cuando necesitamos un cambio ahora mismo,ahí mismo comenzaré.Tengo el poder,tengo la fortaleza,tengo el amor de los que estuvieron antes que yo y me hicieron quien soy.Tengo el coraje, tengo la fuerza,tengo la magia que se forma dentro de mí, me hace quien soy.COROTengo el poder y lo uso cuando digo lo que pienso,tengo la fortaleza y lo pruebo, ¡lo pruebo siempre! Mírame, nunca me doy por vencido.Y tú... tú nunca te das por vencido, entre los dos nos apoyamospara poder seguir viviendo a lo grande.Somos el poder —consigue tu poderSomos la fortaleza —consigue tu fortaleza Somos el amor —consigue tu amorSomos el coraje —consigue tu coraje Somos el impulso —consigue tu impulsoSomos la magia —consigue tu magia ¡Es tu vida! ¡Ve a vivir tu vida!¡Es tu vida! ¡Ve a vivir tu vida!CORO x2
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Alphabet Rockers make music that makes change. Founded by Kaitlin McGaw (she/her) and Tommy Shepherd (he/him), this intergenerational group creates brave spaces to shape a more equitable world through hip hop. Their Grammy-nominated 2018 album Rise Shine #Woke reached 300,000 children and families since its release, inspiring kids to stand up to hate and be their brave and beautiful selves. Their second Grammy-nominated album, The Love (2019), lifts up voices of nonconforming communities. On The Love, you hear the intergenerational sound of the Rockers, with Kali de Jesus (he/him), Lillian Ellis (she/her/hers), Maya Fleming (she/her), and Tommy Shepherd III (he/him) joining McGaw and Shepherd in anthems for change. With headlining performances at Lollapalooza, The Kennedy Center, San Francisco Pride Festival, Art & Soul Festival, and the Smithsonian Museum of African American History and Culture, and in over 50 schools across the country each year, diverse audiences love their contemporary sound and positive messages. They were Izzy Award Winners in 2018, American Library Association’s Top Album in 2017 and 2018, and won the Parents’ Choice Award for their five-album catalog. Alphabet Rockers appeal to a broad audience with lyrics like “I will stand up for you” and “I shine in my beautiful skin,” landing them in the top five songs of 2018 on Kids Place Live SiriusXM Radio. Their music, videos, concerts, and curriculum are designed by an intercultural team of anti-bias thought leaders, educators, artists, parents, and young people of all genders. For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

TITLE: Amigo, ¿cómo te sientes hoy?
SONGCREDIT: "Amigo, ¿cómo te sientes hoy?" from the album Paseando With Sara by Music With Sara. ℗ & © 2016 by Music With Sara. Used by permission of Sara Quintanar. All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: Hola, amiga ¿Cómo te sientes hoy?Me siento muy contenta ¡porque contenta estoy!Amigo ¿qué te pasa?Me siento enojado,un amigo me quitó mi juguete,me siento muy frustrado.Amiga ¿qué pasó?Me siento un poco triste,se me cayó al suelo, la paleta que tú me diste.Hola, amigo ¿Cómo te sientes hoy?Me siento muy alegre ¡porque contigo al parque voy!
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Sara Quintanar of Music With Sara is a California-based bilingual children’s musician, educator, and proud mother of three bilingual children. Her songs are celebrated worldwide for their sweet and simple lyrics, lovely melodies, and cultural flair. Sara has released six albums for children and continues to write and teach music in Spanish. Making music a part of a child’s everyday life is something Sara loves to do. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Inspirational and genuine, Divinity Roxx has earned the reputation of irrefutable front woman of her own genre-bursting and compelling musical journey. Her career as a bass player skyrocketed after attending a bass camp led by the legendary Victor Wooten, where she was invited to tour with him three months after the camp. After touring with Victor for five years, she became the bass player and assistant musical director for Beyoncé. She was given a featured solo by the artist on The Beyoncé Experience and I Am… Sasha Fierce tours and DVDs. She also composed original music for the I Am… Sasha Fierce tour and DVD. Divinity has appeared on countless television shows, including the Grammys, Saturday Night Live, Good Morning America, The Arsenio Hall Show, Ellen, and The American Music Awards, with personal highlights including a special performance at the White House and an appearance on the hit TV show Soul Man. She is the current bass player in the Black Girls Rock Orchestra, which airs on BET, and is the touring bassist and Musical Director for the powerhouse singer and performer Fantasia. Despite her appearances with so many legendary and iconic figures, it is in her solo performance that Divinity shines brightest. She combines virtuosic bass playing with an eclectic mashup of hip-hop, rock, and funk that she calls “Alternative Soul.” Her passion for composition, combined with her lyrical prowess and electrifying stage presence, captivates audiences worldwide. Her 2016 release ImPossible received critical acclaim and earned her an Independent Music Award for Best Spoken Word Album, further highlighting the depth of her lyrical aptitude. The album features the Keith Harris- produced song “We Are,” inspired by her former poetry professor, the late, great June Jordan. The album also features an appearance by her mentor and five-time Grammy-Award-winning artist Victor Wooten. She is currently performing, teaching, and writing multiple projects, including a new album, a stage play, and a series of children’s books and music. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

TITLE: Hola, amigo
SONGCREDIT: "Hola, amigo" from the album ¡Uno, dos, tres, Andrés! en español y en inglés by 123 Andrés. ℗ & © 2015 by Andrés Salguero. Used by permission of Salsana Music (ASCAP). All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: Podemos ser buenos amigos, sin importar de donde venimos,tú y yo podemos llevarnos bien, no hay nada que temer.Aunque hables árabe o italiano, al final somos seres humanos,aunque hables quechua o mandarín, un mismo idioma es sonreír.	Hola, amigo ¿cómo te llamas?Hola, amigo canta conmigoHola, amigo ¿cómo te llamas?Hola, amigo canta conmigoY no me importa de dónde sos, desde que tengas buen corazón,y no me importa cuál es tu idioma, desde que seas buena persona.Venimos de muchos países, y podemos vivir muy felices,cantando esta canción, sueña conmigo un mundo mucho mejor.
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: 123 Andrés are Andrés and Christina, the Latin Grammy–winning duo with catchy songs and a high-energy show in Spanish and English that gets kids and families singing and dancing.Their songs and videos are used in early childhood and elementary classrooms across the United States and abroad, and they have delighted live audiences in the United States, Puerto Rico, Panama, Mexico, and Colombia, at venues including Lollapalooza (Chicago), Kennedy Center (Washington, DC), Symphony Space (NYC), and the Coliseo in San Juan, Puerto Rico.Andrés grew up in Bogotá, Colombia, and learned how to play the guitar from his father as a child. He studied clarinet at the Conservatory and had his first studio experience at age eight. He went on to earn a doctorate in music and won first prize in the National Composition Contest in Colombia for one of his early songs.Christina was raised in the United States in a Spanish-speaking family hailing from Colombia, and studied theater and dance as a child. After serving as a classroom teacher in public schools and earning a Master’s in Education from the University of Pennsylvania, she found her mission teaching through music.123 Andrés maintains an active calendar of live concerts and joy-filled shows for student and family audiences that get everyone singing, moving, and learning. Their first children’s book, due out August 2020, is being published by Scholastic. They also have four acclaimed CDs under their belts.For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Lauren Mayer is the co-founder of Curriculum Rocks with her sister, curriculum specialist Nancy Mayer. Lauren is an award-winning songwriter, a Phi Beta Kappa graduate of Yale University, and a five-time recipient of the San Francisco Cabaret Gold Award. She has written and recorded eight albums of educational music for Curriculum Rocks, sharing vocal duties with her husband, singer Scott Grinthal. Lauren and Scott are also a switch on the traditional musical duo (she’s the wisecracking pianist; he’s the lovely crooner), performing their marital cabaret, “Yes, Dear!”  For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

TITLE: Pieces Of A Quilt
SONGCREDIT: "Pieces of a Quilt" from the album Second Grade Rocks by Curriculum Rocks. ℗ & © 2004 by Lauren Mayer. Used by permission of Lauren Mayer. All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: CORO (parte a) Un lugar al que todos pueden pertenecer y nuestras diferencias nos fortalecen. Nadie es como yo, de eso se trata la diversidad, donde eres libre de hacer lo que quieras y nadie te critica, porque nuestro país se construye como las piezas de un edredón. (parte b) Somos piezas de un edredón de muchos colores, mira cómo se fusionan en armonía y cada pieza está incompleta sin las otras. Cocer un edredón hecho de tú y yo. (repetir ambas en contrapunto) Un edredón está hecho de muchos cuadrados, diferentes diseños todos unidos y a nadie le importa quién hizo cuál, el resultado es tu creación. En Estados Unidos hay una variedad de culturas y costumbres de diferentes lugares, diferentes idiomas, diferentes rostros a quienes vemos igualmente extraños. CORO (ambas partes en contrapunto) Podemos compartir muchas cosas geniales de muchos países fantásticos, como toda la comida que hemos aprendido a reconocer ¡Bageles, chow mein, espaguetis y papas fritas! Todas las culturas de las cuales venimos crean el crisol que nos compone, no hay nada que temer, ¡las variedades hacen bullicio! CORO (parte a, parte b, luego ambas partes en contrapunto) FINAL: Como piezas de un edredón, como piezas de un edredón hecho de tú y yo

ESLYRICS: Mi comunidad, mi comunidad, tiene muchos ayudantes que trabajan sin parar Mi comunidad, mi comunidad, tiene muchos ayudantes que trabajan sin parar En mi comunidad hay unas personas muy especiales. ¡Les voy a contar acerca de ellos! Ella me ayuda en la escuela. ¡Gracias a los ayudantes de la comunidad!

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Little Miss Ann (Ann Torralba) is an award-winning Chicago kids’ musician, a former Chicago public school teacher, an instructor at Chicago's revered Old Town School of Folk Music, a mom, and a first-generation Filipina-American. Little Miss Ann, along with her band, tour throughout the United States and have played kids’ music concerts, including SXSW, Lollapalooza Kids Stage, McCabe's in Los Angeles, and New York City’s Brookfield Place. Little Miss Ann has made five upbeat, down-to-earth, interactive kids’ albums, including Keep On, on which she collaborated with kids’ music newcomer Amy D. Amy D (Amyliza de Jesus) is also a first-generation Filipina-American, an award-winning singer-songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist. Based in Nashville, she is a songwriter for the Country Music Hall of Fame's Words & Music program, as well as a social worker and music therapist-in-training. As the mom of a young toddler, she enjoys writing music for families and continues to play live music locally. Amy and Ann connected through their shared Filipino-American heritage and love of folk music. For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Alphabet Rockers make music that makes change. Founded by Kaitlin McGaw (she/her) and Tommy Shepherd (he/him), this intergenerational group creates brave spaces to shape a more equitable world through hip hop. Their Grammy-nominated 2018 album Rise Shine #Woke reached 300,000 children and families since its release, inspiring kids to stand up to hate and be their brave and beautiful selves. Their second Grammy-nominated album, The Love (2019), lifts up voices of nonconforming communities. On The Love, you hear the intergenerational sound of the Rockers, with Kali de Jesus (he/him), Lillian Ellis (she/her/hers), Maya Fleming (she/her), and Tommy Shepherd III (he/him) joining McGaw and Shepherd in anthems for change. With headlining performances at Lollapalooza, The Kennedy Center, San Francisco Pride Festival, Art & Soul Festival, and the Smithsonian Museum of African American History and Culture, and in over 50 schools across the country each year, diverse audiences love their contemporary sound and positive messages. They were Izzy Award Winners in 2018, American Library Association’s Top Album in 2017 and 2018, and won the Parents’ Choice Award for their five-album catalog. Alphabet Rockers appeal to a broad audience with lyrics like “I will stand up for you” and “I shine in my beautiful skin,” landing them in the top five songs of 2018 on Kids Place Live SiriusXM Radio. Their music, videos, concerts, and curriculum are designed by an intercultural team of anti-bias thought leaders, educators, artists, parents, and young people of all genders. For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Birdie’s Playhouse offers award-winning music with a Latin twist and has been featured at venues across Los Angeles, including Santa Monica Pier, LA Zoo, Skirball Cultural Center, Levitt Pavilion, Natural History Museum, Kidspace Museum, New Children's Museum (San Diego), Zimmer Children's Museum, Grand Park Bookfest, McCabe's Guitar Shop, Theatricum Botanicum, Griffith Park Travel Town, Original Farmer's Market, The Grove, and hundreds of festivals, schools, libraries, and venues across SoCal.Michele Moreno (aka Birdie) is the founder and songwriter and was the only Latina Ray Charles backup singer in history. She has also sung on numerous TV and film scores.  In the ’90s, Michele taught science concepts through interactive musical theater at the Lawrence Hall of Science at UC Berkeley and presented science-based bubble festivals at preschools and K–8 schools across the Bay Area. She has performed all over the world as a live backup and lead singer and graduated with honors from Stanford University. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

ESLYRICS: COROMúsculos, estómago, huesos y corazón,todas las partes del cuerpo funcionan en conjunto.Y está todo unidoporque todos los cuerpos son iguales por dentro.Mi cuerpo es como una máquina genial que puede hacer cosas maravillosas,aunque no mucho de ello pueda verse, lo que hay por dentro también es imponenteCOROMúsculos, estómago, huesos y corazón,todas las partes del cuerpo funcionan en conjunto.Y está todo unidoporque todos los cuerpos son iguales por dentro.Tus huesos conforman tu esqueleto y te ayudan a moverte,sin ellos, no podrías correr ni saltar,solo serías un charco dejándose caerCOROMúsculos, estómago, huesos y corazón,todas las partes del cuerpo funcionan en conjunto.Y está todo unidoporque todos los cuerpos son iguales por dentro.El estómago te ayuda a digerir la comidaque saboreas con la lenguay, cuando estás lleno y necesitas descansar,los intestinos te ayudan a deshacerte de los residuosCabeza, hombros, rodillas y dedos del pie,y ahora los pasamos todos:tenemos hígados y pulmones, intestinos y lenguasy ¡qué bueno tener piel para contener todo!COROMúsculos, estómago, huesos y corazón,todas las partes del cuerpo funcionan en conjunto.Y está todo unidoporque todos los cuerpos son iguales por dentro.¡Todos los cuerpos son iguales por dentro!(Oh, sí)
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Lauren Mayer is the co-founder of Curriculum Rocks with her sister, curriculum specialist Nancy Mayer. Lauren is an award-winning songwriter, a Phi Beta Kappa graduate of Yale University, and a five-time recipient of the San Francisco Cabaret Gold Award. She has written and recorded eight albums of educational music for Curriculum Rocks, sharing vocal duties with her husband, singer Scott Grinthal. Lauren and Scott are also a switch on the traditional musical duo (she’s the wisecracking pianist; he’s the lovely crooner), performing their marital cabaret, “Yes, Dear!”  For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

TITLE: Todas las comidas
SONGCREDIT: "Todas las comidas" from the album Piñata Party by Moona Luna. ℗ & © 2010 by Luchadora Records. Used by permission of Sandra Lilia Velasquez. All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: Quiero probar todas las comidas del mundo, hay tantos tipos diferentes que probar,algunas son saladas, y otras dulces, y algunas muy picantes, y otras que tienen los tres sabores Quiero probar todas la comidas del mundo,cada pais tiene tanto de ofrecer,todos tenemos nuestros platos favoritos, pero si no los pruebas todos, ¿cómo los vas a conocer? Quiero probar toda la comida DEL MUNDO
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Moona Luna is the kindie group that the New York Daily News says is providing “the missing soundtrack for bilingual/bicultural kids.” After making a splash on the family music scene with their accordion-driven, Latin-inspired debut album Piñata Party (2011), Moona Luna delivered something fresh in its sophomore album Vamos, Let’s Go! (2013), by taking inspiration from American pop hits of the ’50s and ’60s. Staying true to their bilingual mission, their third album P A N O R A M A (2016) celebrated their Latin roots and drew on broader musical influences from the African diaspora. Moona Luna has performed all over the country, from the National Mall in Washington, DC, to the Ordway Center for the Performing Arts in Minnesota, to Madison Square Park in New York City. Their fourth studio album is set to be released in 2020.  For more information and music, please visit them on the web.
ENLYRICS: I want to try all the foods in the whole world There are so many different types I want to try Some are salty, some are sweet, some are really spicy, and some that are all threeI want to try all the foods in the whole wide worldEvery country has too much to offer me We all have our favorite dishes But if you don’t try them all, how will you know what it could be?I want to try all the foods in the WHOLE WORLD

ESLYRICS: Salta, salta, un, dos, tres,salta, salta, un, dos, tres, salta, salta, un, dos, tres, salta, salta, un, dos, tres,¡dale!Salta, salta, con AndrésMueve los pies, cuenta un, dos, tres,brinca, brinca, que eso no duele,vamos afuera, apaga la tele.Salta, salta, otra vez,cuenta conmigo, saltamos después.Mueve los pies, mueve los pies, ¡un, dos, tres!Salta, salta, un, dos, tres.Salta, salta, un, dos, tressalta, salta, un, dos, tres,salta, salta, un, dos, tres, ¡dale!Ok, veo que sí pueden saltar, pero ¿saben?, creo que aún podemos saltar más alto,Uno, dos, tres, ¡más arriba, más arriba!Uno, dos, tres, Ok, ahora todo el mundo agachado, vamos a saltar a la cuenta de tres. ¡Uno, dos, tres!
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: 123 Andrés are Andrés and Christina, the Latin Grammy–winning duo with catchy songs and a high-energy show in Spanish and English that gets kids and families singing and dancing.Their songs and videos are used in early childhood and elementary classrooms across the United States and abroad, and they have delighted live audiences in the United States, Puerto Rico, Panama, Mexico, and Colombia, at venues including Lollapalooza (Chicago), Kennedy Center (Washington, DC), Symphony Space (NYC), and the Coliseo in San Juan, Puerto Rico.Andrés grew up in Bogotá, Colombia, and learned how to play the guitar from his father as a child. He studied clarinet at the Conservatory and had his first studio experience at age eight. He went on to earn a doctorate in music and won first prize in the National Composition Contest in Colombia for one of his early songs.Christina was raised in the United States in a Spanish-speaking family hailing from Colombia, and studied theater and dance as a child. After serving as a classroom teacher in public schools and earning a Master’s in Education from the University of Pennsylvania, she found her mission teaching through music.123 Andrés maintains an active calendar of live concerts and joy-filled shows for student and family audiences that get everyone singing, moving, and learning. Their first children’s book, due out August 2020, is being published by Scholastic. They also have four acclaimed CDs under their belts.For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Inspirational and genuine, Divinity Roxx has earned the reputation of irrefutable front woman of her own genre-bursting and compelling musical journey. Her career as a bass player skyrocketed after attending a bass camp led by the legendary Victor Wooten, where she was invited to tour with him three months after the camp. After touring with Victor for five years, she became the bass player and assistant musical director for Beyoncé. She was given a featured solo by the artist on The Beyoncé Experience and I Am… Sasha Fierce tours and DVDs. She also composed original music for the I Am… Sasha Fierce tour and DVD. Divinity has appeared on countless television shows, including the Grammys, Saturday Night Live, Good Morning America, The Arsenio Hall Show, Ellen, and The American Music Awards, with personal highlights including a special performance at the White House and an appearance on the hit TV show Soul Man. She is the current bass player in the Black Girls Rock Orchestra, which airs on BET, and is the touring bassist and Musical Director for the powerhouse singer and performer Fantasia. Despite her appearances with so many legendary and iconic figures, it is in her solo performance that Divinity shines brightest. She combines virtuosic bass playing with an eclectic mashup of hip-hop, rock, and funk that she calls “Alternative Soul.” Her passion for composition, combined with her lyrical prowess and electrifying stage presence, captivates audiences worldwide. Her 2016 release ImPossible received critical acclaim and earned her an Independent Music Award for Best Spoken Word Album, further highlighting the depth of her lyrical aptitude. The album features the Keith Harris- produced song “We Are,” inspired by her former poetry professor, the late, great June Jordan. The album also features an appearance by her mentor and five-time Grammy-Award-winning artist Victor Wooten. She is currently performing, teaching, and writing multiple projects, including a new album, a stage play, and a series of children’s books and music. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Little Miss Ann (Ann Torralba) is an award-winning Chicago kids’ musician, a former Chicago public school teacher, an instructor at Chicago's revered Old Town School of Folk Music, a mom, and a first-generation Filipina-American. Little Miss Ann, along with her band, tour throughout the United States and have played kids’ music concerts, including SXSW, Lollapalooza Kids Stage, McCabe's in Los Angeles, and New York City’s Brookfield Place. Little Miss Ann has made five upbeat, down-to-earth, interactive kids’ albums, including Keep On, on which she collaborated with kids’ music newcomer Amy D. Amy D (Amyliza de Jesus) is also a first-generation Filipina-American, an award-winning singer-songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist. Based in Nashville, she is a songwriter for the Country Music Hall of Fame's Words & Music program, as well as a social worker and music therapist-in-training. As the mom of a young toddler, she enjoys writing music for families and continues to play live music locally. Amy and Ann connected through their shared Filipino-American heritage and love of folk music. For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

TITLE: La clave
SONGCREDIT: "La clave" from the album ¡Uno, dos, tres, Andrés! en español y en inglés by 123 Andrés. ℗ & © 2015 by Andrés Salguero. Used by permission of Salsana Music (ASCAP). All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: Escucha la clave, viene para ti.Aprende la clave, que se toca así:¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!Ahora ya la sabes, tócala conmigo.¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!Haz la clave con las manos, haz la ya mientras bailamos.¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!¡Hazla la clave otra vez! Haz la clave con los pies.¡pum, pum, PUM, PUM, PUM!¡pum, pum, PUM, PUM, PUM!Hazla de pies a cabeza. ¡Hazla, que la fiesta ya empieza!Ok, ok, todo el mundo a inventarnos algo. Vamos por un pocillo y un tenedor y a ¡hacer la clave con sabor!Con pocillo y tenedor, haz la clave con sabor.Ahora tú ya sabes, que la salsa lleva clave.La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! ¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.El que tiene la clave, tiene la llave, ¡ay, sí, sí, sí!¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! ¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.¡Ay! En San Juan, en La Habana, toca la clave Juana la Iguana.La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.En Cali, Colombia, y en Lima, Perú, suena la clave… ¡cántala tú!La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! (4X)Clave, uno, dos, tres!

ENLYRICS: Listen to the clave, I’ll teach it to you.I’ll show you the clave, it’s easy to do.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!Now you know the clave, you can sing it, too.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!Play the clave with your hands, play the clave while you dance.clap, clap, CLAP, CLAP, CLAP!clap, clap, CLAP, CLAP, CLAP!Play the clave with your feet. Play the clave, feel the beat.stomp, stomp, STOMP, STOMP, STOMP!stomp, stomp, STOMP, STOMP, STOMP!Play the clave with your body. Play the clave, join the party!Ok, ok, everybody, listen up! It’s time to get creative. Go get a mug and a fork.Let’s do the clave!With a mug and a fork, play the clave, make it work.Now you know the clave, which is the key to Salsa.The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.Now you know the clave my friend, sing it with me.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.In San Juan, in Havana, play the clave Juana la Igauana.The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.In Cali, Colombia, and in Lima, Peru, play the clave... you sing!The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! (4X)Clave, one, two, three!

ESLYRICS: Si tuviera un mariachi, tocaría el violín.Tocaría el violín, si yo tuviera un mariachi.¡Qué bonito el violín!Si tuviera un mariachi, tocaría el guitarrón.Tocaría el guitarrón, si yo tuviera un mariachi.¡Qué bonitos el guitarrón y el violín!Si tuviera un mariachi, tocaría la vihuela.Tocaría la vihuela, si yo tuviera un mariachi.¡Qué bonitos la vihuela, el guitarrón y el violín!Si tuviera un mariachi, tocaría la guitarra.Tocaría la guitarra, si yo tuviera un mariachi.¡Qué bonitos la guitarra, la vihuela, el guitarróny el violín!Si tuviera un mariachi, tocaría la trompeta.Tocaría la trompeta, si yo tuviera un mariachi.¡Qué bonitos la trompeta, la guitarra, la vihuela,el guitarrón y el violín! Y ahora todo el mundo, ¡tocando el violín!Toca mi mariachi, que suene el mariachi.Toca mi mariachi, que suene el mariachi, ¡hasta el fin!
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: 123 Andrés are Andrés and Christina, the Latin Grammy–winning duo with catchy songs and a high-energy show in Spanish and English that gets kids and families singing and dancing.Their songs and videos are used in early childhood and elementary classrooms across the United States and abroad, and they have delighted live audiences in the United States, Puerto Rico, Panama, Mexico, and Colombia, at venues including Lollapalooza (Chicago), Kennedy Center (Washington, DC), Symphony Space (NYC), and the Coliseo in San Juan, Puerto Rico.Andrés grew up in Bogotá, Colombia, and learned how to play the guitar from his father as a child. He studied clarinet at the Conservatory and had his first studio experience at age eight. He went on to earn a doctorate in music and won first prize in the National Composition Contest in Colombia for one of his early songs.Christina was raised in the United States in a Spanish-speaking family hailing from Colombia, and studied theater and dance as a child. After serving as a classroom teacher in public schools and earning a Master’s in Education from the University of Pennsylvania, she found her mission teaching through music.123 Andrés maintains an active calendar of live concerts and joy-filled shows for student and family audiences that get everyone singing, moving, and learning. Their first children’s book, due out August 2020, is being published by Scholastic. They also have four acclaimed CDs under their belts.For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

Now everybody play the violin.Listen, my mariachi. I love my mariachi.Listen, my mariachi. I love my mariachi.Play with me!

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Moona Luna is the kindie group that the New York Daily News says is providing “the missing soundtrack for bilingual/bicultural kids.” After making a splash on the family music scene with their accordion-driven, Latin-inspired debut album Piñata Party (2011), Moona Luna delivered something fresh in its sophomore album Vamos, Let’s Go! (2013), by taking inspiration from American pop hits of the ’50s and ’60s. Staying true to their bilingual mission, their third album P A N O R A M A (2016) celebrated their Latin roots and drew on broader musical influences from the African diaspora. Moona Luna has performed all over the country, from the National Mall in Washington, DC, to the Ordway Center for the Performing Arts in Minnesota, to Madison Square Park in New York City. Their fourth studio album is set to be released in 2020.  For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

TITLE: The Four Seasons
SONGCREDIT: "The Four Seasons" from the album Vamos, Let's Go! by Moona Luna. ℗ & © 2013 by Moona Luna. Used by permission of Sandra Lilia Velasquez. All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: En septiembre, el cielo es azul.En octubre, las hojas cambian color.En noviembre, me pongo a hornear.Así es el otoño.En diciembre, brillan lucecitas.En enero, juego en mi casita.Ya en febrero, he sobrevivido.Así es el invierno.En marzo y abril y en mayola primavera trae el sol y ya no se va a ningún lado.En junio, sale la escuela.En julio, estoy en la arena.En agosto, estoy relajada.Por eso me encanta el verano.Por eso me encanta el verano.Por eso me encanta el verano.

TITLE: The Seed
SONGCREDIT: "The Seed" from the album Arriba Abajo by 123 Andrés. ℗ & © 2016 by Andrés Salguero. Used by permission of Salsana Music (ASCAP). All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: Toma una fruta. Ábrela por la mitad, y adentro, encontrarás una semilla.Tomamos esa semilla y la sembramos en el suelo.Tomo una semilla. La siembro en el suelo.Con tierra, agua y sol,crecerá una planta, alta como el cielo.Y de esa planta saldrá otra fruta, y de la fruta saldrá otra semilla.Tomo esa semilla. La siembro en el suelo.Con tierra, agua y sol,crecerá otra planta, alta como el cielo.Y de esa planta salen muchas frutas, y de esas frutas salen muchas semillas, y las vamos a sembrar.Tomo esas semillas. Las siembro en el suelo. Con tierra, agua y sol,crecerá un bosque, alto como el cielo.Y de esos árboles del bosque saldrán frutas, y de esas frutas también van a salir semillas, y vamos a sembrar una vez más.Tomo las semillas. Las siembro en el suelo. Y todo este bosque salió de una sola semilla. Eso es lo que puedes hacer ¡con una semilla!

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Ladies and Gentlestems, bulbs and girls, it’s time to shake your stems, do the jumping bean, and twist and sprout with the freshest bunch in town! The Vegetable Plot is an award-winning musical group for kids and families that has been spreading its funky roots all over the world.  Serving up a big, wriggling heap of catchy tunes, colorful characters, quizzes, dances, jokes, and vegetable-related puns, this soilful bunch will plant melodies in your head that will blossom for years to come. Created by award-winning songwriter and storyteller Luke Escombe (aka Aspara Gus), The Vegetable Plot burst onto the Australian music scene in 2014, winning the prize for best kids’ show at the Sydney Fringe. Since then the project has become a hotbed for some of the tastiest homegrown talent in Australia, including folk group All Our Exes Live in Texas and singing sensation Alice Terry, making them a band that adults can enjoy just as much as kids. In fact, some of The Vegetable Plot's biggest fans admit to listening even when the little ones aren't around. After four years in the soil, the band's long-awaited second album, Season Two, emerged at the end of 2019. Broc-full of songs about vegetables, bedtime routines, more vegetables, community gardens, farmer's markets, yet more vegetables, urban living, alien worlds, the cycles of life, herbs and spices, and all the essential vegetables you'll need for the holidays (including TWO songs about pumpkins), Season Two has taken the group to new heights, securing them a deal with ABC Kids and a recent support slot with The Wiggles.  So come and join Aspara Gus, Ru Barb, Sir Paul McCarrotney, and friends as they take you deep underground for a ride on the soil train and show you exactly why families across the world are embracing these funky food revolutionaries and their mission of love and peas.  For more information and music like this, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Sara Quintanar of Music With Sara is a California-based bilingual children’s musician, educator, and proud mother of three bilingual children. Her songs are celebrated worldwide for their sweet and simple lyrics, lovely melodies, and cultural flair. Sara has released six albums for children and continues to write and teach music in Spanish. Making music a part of a child’s everyday life is something Sara loves to do. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Inspirational and genuine, Divinity Roxx has earned the reputation of irrefutable front woman of her own genre-bursting and compelling musical journey. Her career as a bass player skyrocketed after attending a bass camp led by the legendary Victor Wooten, where she was invited to tour with him three months after the camp. After touring with Victor for five years, she became the bass player and assistant musical director for Beyoncé. She was given a featured solo by the artist on The Beyoncé Experience and I Am… Sasha Fierce tours and DVDs. She also composed original music for the I Am… Sasha Fierce tour and DVD. Divinity has appeared on countless television shows, including the Grammys, Saturday Night Live, Good Morning America, The Arsenio Hall Show, Ellen, and The American Music Awards, with personal highlights including a special performance at the White House and an appearance on the hit TV show Soul Man. She is the current bass player in the Black Girls Rock Orchestra, which airs on BET, and is the touring bassist and Musical Director for the powerhouse singer and performer Fantasia. Despite her appearances with so many legendary and iconic figures, it is in her solo performance that Divinity shines brightest. She combines virtuosic bass playing with an eclectic mashup of hip-hop, rock, and funk that she calls “Alternative Soul.” Her passion for composition, combined with her lyrical prowess and electrifying stage presence, captivates audiences worldwide. Her 2016 release ImPossible received critical acclaim and earned her an Independent Music Award for Best Spoken Word Album, further highlighting the depth of her lyrical aptitude. The album features the Keith Harris- produced song “We Are,” inspired by her former poetry professor, the late, great June Jordan. The album also features an appearance by her mentor and five-time Grammy-Award-winning artist Victor Wooten. She is currently performing, teaching, and writing multiple projects, including a new album, a stage play, and a series of children’s books and music. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Inspirational and genuine, Divinity Roxx has earned the reputation of irrefutable front woman of her own genre-bursting and compelling musical journey. Her career as a bass player skyrocketed after attending a bass camp led by the legendary Victor Wooten, where she was invited to tour with him three months after the camp. After touring with Victor for five years, she became the bass player and assistant musical director for Beyoncé. She was given a featured solo by the artist on The Beyoncé Experience and I Am… Sasha Fierce tours and DVDs. She also composed original music for the I Am… Sasha Fierce tour and DVD. Divinity has appeared on countless television shows, including the Grammys, Saturday Night Live, Good Morning America, The Arsenio Hall Show, Ellen, and The American Music Awards, with personal highlights including a special performance at the White House and an appearance on the hit TV show Soul Man. She is the current bass player in the Black Girls Rock Orchestra, which airs on BET, and is the touring bassist and Musical Director for the powerhouse singer and performer Fantasia. Despite her appearances with so many legendary and iconic figures, it is in her solo performance that Divinity shines brightest. She combines virtuosic bass playing with an eclectic mashup of hip-hop, rock, and funk that she calls “Alternative Soul.” Her passion for composition, combined with her lyrical prowess and electrifying stage presence, captivates audiences worldwide. Her 2016 release ImPossible received critical acclaim and earned her an Independent Music Award for Best Spoken Word Album, further highlighting the depth of her lyrical aptitude. The album features the Keith Harris- produced song “We Are,” inspired by her former poetry professor, the late, great June Jordan. The album also features an appearance by her mentor and five-time Grammy-Award-winning artist Victor Wooten. She is currently performing, teaching, and writing multiple projects, including a new album, a stage play, and a series of children’s books and music. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Alphabet Rockers make music that makes change. Founded by Kaitlin McGaw (she/her) and Tommy Shepherd (he/him), this intergenerational group creates brave spaces to shape a more equitable world through hip hop. Their Grammy-nominated 2018 album Rise Shine #Woke reached 300,000 children and families since its release, inspiring kids to stand up to hate and be their brave and beautiful selves. Their second Grammy-nominated album, The Love (2019), lifts up voices of nonconforming communities. On The Love, you hear the intergenerational sound of the Rockers, with Kali de Jesus (he/him), Lillian Ellis (she/her/hers), Maya Fleming (she/her), and Tommy Shepherd III (he/him) joining McGaw and Shepherd in anthems for change. With headlining performances at Lollapalooza, The Kennedy Center, San Francisco Pride Festival, Art & Soul Festival, and the Smithsonian Museum of African American History and Culture, and in over 50 schools across the country each year, diverse audiences love their contemporary sound and positive messages. They were Izzy Award Winners in 2018, American Library Association’s Top Album in 2017 and 2018, and won the Parents’ Choice Award for their five-album catalog. Alphabet Rockers appeal to a broad audience with lyrics like “I will stand up for you” and “I shine in my beautiful skin,” landing them in the top five songs of 2018 on Kids Place Live SiriusXM Radio. Their music, videos, concerts, and curriculum are designed by an intercultural team of anti-bias thought leaders, educators, artists, parents, and young people of all genders. For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Sara Quintanar of Music With Sara is a California-based bilingual children’s musician, educator, and proud mother of three bilingual children. Her songs are celebrated worldwide for their sweet and simple lyrics, lovely melodies, and cultural flair. Sara has released six albums for children and continues to write and teach music in Spanish. Making music a part of a child’s everyday life is something Sara loves to do. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

ESLYRICS: Podemos ser buenos amigos, sin importar de donde venimos,tú y yo podemos llevarnos bien, no hay nada que temer.Aunque hables árabe o italiano, al final somos seres humanos,aunque hables quechua o mandarín, un mismo idioma es sonreír.	Hola, amigo ¿cómo te llamas?Hola, amigo canta conmigoHola, amigo ¿cómo te llamas?Hola, amigo canta conmigoY no me importa de dónde sos, desde que tengas buen corazón,y no me importa cuál es tu idioma, desde que seas buena persona.Venimos de muchos países, y podemos vivir muy felices,cantando esta canción, sueña conmigo un mundo mucho mejor.
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: 123 Andrés are Andrés and Christina, the Latin Grammy–winning duo with catchy songs and a high-energy show in Spanish and English that gets kids and families singing and dancing.Their songs and videos are used in early childhood and elementary classrooms across the United States and abroad, and they have delighted live audiences in the United States, Puerto Rico, Panama, Mexico, and Colombia, at venues including Lollapalooza (Chicago), Kennedy Center (Washington, DC), Symphony Space (NYC), and the Coliseo in San Juan, Puerto Rico.Andrés grew up in Bogotá, Colombia, and learned how to play the guitar from his father as a child. He studied clarinet at the Conservatory and had his first studio experience at age eight. He went on to earn a doctorate in music and won first prize in the National Composition Contest in Colombia for one of his early songs.Christina was raised in the United States in a Spanish-speaking family hailing from Colombia, and studied theater and dance as a child. After serving as a classroom teacher in public schools and earning a Master’s in Education from the University of Pennsylvania, she found her mission teaching through music.123 Andrés maintains an active calendar of live concerts and joy-filled shows for student and family audiences that get everyone singing, moving, and learning. Their first children’s book, due out August 2020, is being published by Scholastic. They also have four acclaimed CDs under their belts.For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Lauren Mayer is the co-founder of Curriculum Rocks with her sister, curriculum specialist Nancy Mayer. Lauren is an award-winning songwriter, a Phi Beta Kappa graduate of Yale University, and a five-time recipient of the San Francisco Cabaret Gold Award. She has written and recorded eight albums of educational music for Curriculum Rocks, sharing vocal duties with her husband, singer Scott Grinthal. Lauren and Scott are also a switch on the traditional musical duo (she’s the wisecracking pianist; he’s the lovely crooner), performing their marital cabaret, “Yes, Dear!”  For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

TITLE: Pieces Of A Quilt
SONGCREDIT: "Pieces of a Quilt" from the album Second Grade Rocks by Curriculum Rocks. ℗ & © 2004 by Lauren Mayer. Used by permission of Lauren Mayer. All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: CORO (parte a) Un lugar al que todos pueden pertenecer y nuestras diferencias nos fortalecen. Nadie es como yo, de eso se trata la diversidad, donde eres libre de hacer lo que quieras y nadie te critica, porque nuestro país se construye como las piezas de un edredón. (parte b) Somos piezas de un edredón de muchos colores, mira cómo se fusionan en armonía y cada pieza está incompleta sin las otras. Cocer un edredón hecho de tú y yo. (repetir ambas en contrapunto) Un edredón está hecho de muchos cuadrados, diferentes diseños todos unidos y a nadie le importa quién hizo cuál, el resultado es tu creación. En Estados Unidos hay una variedad de culturas y costumbres de diferentes lugares, diferentes idiomas, diferentes rostros a quienes vemos igualmente extraños. CORO (ambas partes en contrapunto) Podemos compartir muchas cosas geniales de muchos países fantásticos, como toda la comida que hemos aprendido a reconocer ¡Bageles, chow mein, espaguetis y papas fritas! Todas las culturas de las cuales venimos crean el crisol que nos compone, no hay nada que temer, ¡las variedades hacen bullicio! CORO (parte a, parte b, luego ambas partes en contrapunto) FINAL: Como piezas de un edredón, como piezas de un edredón hecho de tú y yo

TITLE: Mi Comunidad
SONGCREDIT: "Mi comunidad" by 123 Andrés. ℗ & © 2020 by Andrés Salguero. Used by permission of Salsana Music (ASCAP). All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: Mi comunidad, mi comunidad, tiene muchos ayudantes que trabajan sin parar Mi comunidad, mi comunidad, tiene muchos ayudantes que trabajan sin parar En mi comunidad hay unas personas muy especiales. ¡Les voy a contar acerca de ellos! Cuando hay que apagar el fuego ¡es una emergencia! Pronto vienen los bomberos ¿oyes la sirena? Cuando voy a la escuela ¡cruza la calle con cuidado! Hay una guardia que me espera ¡ella detiene los carros! ¿Los bomberos, la guardia de cruce, qué otros ayudantes hay en nuestra comunidad? Mi comunidad, mi comunidad, tiene muchos ayudantes que trabajan sin parar Mi comunidad, mi comunidad, tiene muchos ayudantes que trabajan sin parar Cuando te mandan una carta ¡es de mi abuelo! ¿Quién te la lleva a la puerta? ¡Fue el cartero! Cuando yo estoy enferma ¡siento dolor! Me cuida la enfermera ¡ya estoy mejor! Mi comunidad, mi comunidad, tiene muchos ayudantes que trabajan sin parar Mi comunidad, mi comunidad, tiene muchos ayudantes que trabajan sin parar Hay muchos ayudantes de la comunidad, como el conductor de bus, que nos lleva a muchos lugares.  ¡También está mi maestra! Ella me ayuda en la escuela. ¡Gracias a los ayudantes de la comunidad!
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: 123 Andrés are Andrés and Christina, the Latin Grammy–winning duo with catchy songs and a high-energy show in Spanish and English that gets kids and families singing and dancing.Their songs and videos are used in early childhood and elementary classrooms across the United States and abroad, and they have delighted live audiences in the United States, Puerto Rico, Panama, Mexico, and Colombia, at venues including Lollapalooza (Chicago), Kennedy Center (Washington, DC), Symphony Space (NYC), and the Coliseo in San Juan, Puerto Rico.Andrés grew up in Bogotá, Colombia, and learned how to play the guitar from his father as a child. He studied clarinet at the Conservatory and had his first studio experience at age eight. He went on to earn a doctorate in music and won first prize in the National Composition Contest in Colombia for one of his early songs.Christina was raised in the United States in a Spanish-speaking family hailing from Colombia, and studied theater and dance as a child. After serving as a classroom teacher in public schools and earning a Master’s in Education from the University of Pennsylvania, she found her mission teaching through music.123 Andrés maintains an active calendar of live concerts and joy-filled shows for student and family audiences that get everyone singing, moving, and learning. Their first children’s book, due out August 2020, is being published by Scholastic. They also have four acclaimed CDs under their belts.For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Sara Quintanar of Music With Sara is a California-based bilingual children’s musician, educator, and proud mother of three bilingual children. Her songs are celebrated worldwide for their sweet and simple lyrics, lovely melodies, and cultural flair. Sara has released six albums for children and continues to write and teach music in Spanish. Making music a part of a child’s everyday life is something Sara loves to do. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

SongAuthorsNAME: Little Miss Ann and Amy D
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Little Miss Ann (Ann Torralba) is an award-winning Chicago kids’ musician, a former Chicago public school teacher, an instructor at Chicago's revered Old Town School of Folk Music, a mom, and a first-generation Filipina-American. Little Miss Ann, along with her band, tour throughout the United States and have played kids’ music concerts, including SXSW, Lollapalooza Kids Stage, McCabe's in Los Angeles, and New York City’s Brookfield Place. Little Miss Ann has made five upbeat, down-to-earth, interactive kids’ albums, including Keep On, on which she collaborated with kids’ music newcomer Amy D. Amy D (Amyliza de Jesus) is also a first-generation Filipina-American, an award-winning singer-songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist. Based in Nashville, she is a songwriter for the Country Music Hall of Fame's Words & Music program, as well as a social worker and music therapist-in-training. As the mom of a young toddler, she enjoys writing music for families and continues to play live music locally. Amy and Ann connected through their shared Filipino-American heritage and love of folk music. For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Alphabet Rockers make music that makes change. Founded by Kaitlin McGaw (she/her) and Tommy Shepherd (he/him), this intergenerational group creates brave spaces to shape a more equitable world through hip hop. Their Grammy-nominated 2018 album Rise Shine #Woke reached 300,000 children and families since its release, inspiring kids to stand up to hate and be their brave and beautiful selves. Their second Grammy-nominated album, The Love (2019), lifts up voices of nonconforming communities. On The Love, you hear the intergenerational sound of the Rockers, with Kali de Jesus (he/him), Lillian Ellis (she/her/hers), Maya Fleming (she/her), and Tommy Shepherd III (he/him) joining McGaw and Shepherd in anthems for change. With headlining performances at Lollapalooza, The Kennedy Center, San Francisco Pride Festival, Art & Soul Festival, and the Smithsonian Museum of African American History and Culture, and in over 50 schools across the country each year, diverse audiences love their contemporary sound and positive messages. They were Izzy Award Winners in 2018, American Library Association’s Top Album in 2017 and 2018, and won the Parents’ Choice Award for their five-album catalog. Alphabet Rockers appeal to a broad audience with lyrics like “I will stand up for you” and “I shine in my beautiful skin,” landing them in the top five songs of 2018 on Kids Place Live SiriusXM Radio. Their music, videos, concerts, and curriculum are designed by an intercultural team of anti-bias thought leaders, educators, artists, parents, and young people of all genders. For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Birdie’s Playhouse offers award-winning music with a Latin twist and has been featured at venues across Los Angeles, including Santa Monica Pier, LA Zoo, Skirball Cultural Center, Levitt Pavilion, Natural History Museum, Kidspace Museum, New Children's Museum (San Diego), Zimmer Children's Museum, Grand Park Bookfest, McCabe's Guitar Shop, Theatricum Botanicum, Griffith Park Travel Town, Original Farmer's Market, The Grove, and hundreds of festivals, schools, libraries, and venues across SoCal.Michele Moreno (aka Birdie) is the founder and songwriter and was the only Latina Ray Charles backup singer in history. She has also sung on numerous TV and film scores.  In the ’90s, Michele taught science concepts through interactive musical theater at the Lawrence Hall of Science at UC Berkeley and presented science-based bubble festivals at preschools and K–8 schools across the Bay Area. She has performed all over the world as a live backup and lead singer and graduated with honors from Stanford University. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Lauren Mayer is the co-founder of Curriculum Rocks with her sister, curriculum specialist Nancy Mayer. Lauren is an award-winning songwriter, a Phi Beta Kappa graduate of Yale University, and a five-time recipient of the San Francisco Cabaret Gold Award. She has written and recorded eight albums of educational music for Curriculum Rocks, sharing vocal duties with her husband, singer Scott Grinthal. Lauren and Scott are also a switch on the traditional musical duo (she’s the wisecracking pianist; he’s the lovely crooner), performing their marital cabaret, “Yes, Dear!”  For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Moona Luna is the kindie group that the New York Daily News says is providing “the missing soundtrack for bilingual/bicultural kids.” After making a splash on the family music scene with their accordion-driven, Latin-inspired debut album Piñata Party (2011), Moona Luna delivered something fresh in its sophomore album Vamos, Let’s Go! (2013), by taking inspiration from American pop hits of the ’50s and ’60s. Staying true to their bilingual mission, their third album P A N O R A M A (2016) celebrated their Latin roots and drew on broader musical influences from the African diaspora. Moona Luna has performed all over the country, from the National Mall in Washington, DC, to the Ordway Center for the Performing Arts in Minnesota, to Madison Square Park in New York City. Their fourth studio album is set to be released in 2020.  For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: 123 Andrés are Andrés and Christina, the Latin Grammy–winning duo with catchy songs and a high-energy show in Spanish and English that gets kids and families singing and dancing.Their songs and videos are used in early childhood and elementary classrooms across the United States and abroad, and they have delighted live audiences in the United States, Puerto Rico, Panama, Mexico, and Colombia, at venues including Lollapalooza (Chicago), Kennedy Center (Washington, DC), Symphony Space (NYC), and the Coliseo in San Juan, Puerto Rico.Andrés grew up in Bogotá, Colombia, and learned how to play the guitar from his father as a child. He studied clarinet at the Conservatory and had his first studio experience at age eight. He went on to earn a doctorate in music and won first prize in the National Composition Contest in Colombia for one of his early songs.Christina was raised in the United States in a Spanish-speaking family hailing from Colombia, and studied theater and dance as a child. After serving as a classroom teacher in public schools and earning a Master’s in Education from the University of Pennsylvania, she found her mission teaching through music.123 Andrés maintains an active calendar of live concerts and joy-filled shows for student and family audiences that get everyone singing, moving, and learning. Their first children’s book, due out August 2020, is being published by Scholastic. They also have four acclaimed CDs under their belts.For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Inspirational and genuine, Divinity Roxx has earned the reputation of irrefutable front woman of her own genre-bursting and compelling musical journey. Her career as a bass player skyrocketed after attending a bass camp led by the legendary Victor Wooten, where she was invited to tour with him three months after the camp. After touring with Victor for five years, she became the bass player and assistant musical director for Beyoncé. She was given a featured solo by the artist on The Beyoncé Experience and I Am… Sasha Fierce tours and DVDs. She also composed original music for the I Am… Sasha Fierce tour and DVD. Divinity has appeared on countless television shows, including the Grammys, Saturday Night Live, Good Morning America, The Arsenio Hall Show, Ellen, and The American Music Awards, with personal highlights including a special performance at the White House and an appearance on the hit TV show Soul Man. She is the current bass player in the Black Girls Rock Orchestra, which airs on BET, and is the touring bassist and Musical Director for the powerhouse singer and performer Fantasia. Despite her appearances with so many legendary and iconic figures, it is in her solo performance that Divinity shines brightest. She combines virtuosic bass playing with an eclectic mashup of hip-hop, rock, and funk that she calls “Alternative Soul.” Her passion for composition, combined with her lyrical prowess and electrifying stage presence, captivates audiences worldwide. Her 2016 release ImPossible received critical acclaim and earned her an Independent Music Award for Best Spoken Word Album, further highlighting the depth of her lyrical aptitude. The album features the Keith Harris- produced song “We Are,” inspired by her former poetry professor, the late, great June Jordan. The album also features an appearance by her mentor and five-time Grammy-Award-winning artist Victor Wooten. She is currently performing, teaching, and writing multiple projects, including a new album, a stage play, and a series of children’s books and music. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Little Miss Ann (Ann Torralba) is an award-winning Chicago kids’ musician, a former Chicago public school teacher, an instructor at Chicago's revered Old Town School of Folk Music, a mom, and a first-generation Filipina-American. Little Miss Ann, along with her band, tour throughout the United States and have played kids’ music concerts, including SXSW, Lollapalooza Kids Stage, McCabe's in Los Angeles, and New York City’s Brookfield Place. Little Miss Ann has made five upbeat, down-to-earth, interactive kids’ albums, including Keep On, on which she collaborated with kids’ music newcomer Amy D. Amy D (Amyliza de Jesus) is also a first-generation Filipina-American, an award-winning singer-songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist. Based in Nashville, she is a songwriter for the Country Music Hall of Fame's Words & Music program, as well as a social worker and music therapist-in-training. As the mom of a young toddler, she enjoys writing music for families and continues to play live music locally. Amy and Ann connected through their shared Filipino-American heritage and love of folk music. For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

TITLE: La clave
SONGCREDIT: "La clave" from the album ¡Uno, dos, tres, Andrés! en español y en inglés by 123 Andrés. ℗ & © 2015 by Andrés Salguero. Used by permission of Salsana Music (ASCAP). All rights reserved.
ESLYRICS: Escucha la clave, viene para ti.Aprende la clave, que se toca así:¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!Ahora ya la sabes, tócala conmigo.¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!Haz la clave con las manos, haz la ya mientras bailamos.¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!¡Hazla la clave otra vez! Haz la clave con los pies.¡pum, pum, PUM, PUM, PUM!¡pum, pum, PUM, PUM, PUM!Hazla de pies a cabeza. ¡Hazla, que la fiesta ya empieza!Ok, ok, todo el mundo a inventarnos algo. Vamos por un pocillo y un tenedor y a ¡hacer la clave con sabor!Con pocillo y tenedor, haz la clave con sabor.Ahora tú ya sabes, que la salsa lleva clave.La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! ¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.El que tiene la clave, tiene la llave, ¡ay, sí, sí, sí!¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! ¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.¡Ay! En San Juan, en La Habana, toca la clave Juana la Iguana.La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.En Cali, Colombia, y en Lima, Perú, suena la clave… ¡cántala tú!La salsa lleva clave, y ahora tú lo sabes.¡pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! (4X)Clave, uno, dos, tres!
SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: 123 Andrés are Andrés and Christina, the Latin Grammy–winning duo with catchy songs and a high-energy show in Spanish and English that gets kids and families singing and dancing.Their songs and videos are used in early childhood and elementary classrooms across the United States and abroad, and they have delighted live audiences in the United States, Puerto Rico, Panama, Mexico, and Colombia, at venues including Lollapalooza (Chicago), Kennedy Center (Washington, DC), Symphony Space (NYC), and the Coliseo in San Juan, Puerto Rico.Andrés grew up in Bogotá, Colombia, and learned how to play the guitar from his father as a child. He studied clarinet at the Conservatory and had his first studio experience at age eight. He went on to earn a doctorate in music and won first prize in the National Composition Contest in Colombia for one of his early songs.Christina was raised in the United States in a Spanish-speaking family hailing from Colombia, and studied theater and dance as a child. After serving as a classroom teacher in public schools and earning a Master’s in Education from the University of Pennsylvania, she found her mission teaching through music.123 Andrés maintains an active calendar of live concerts and joy-filled shows for student and family audiences that get everyone singing, moving, and learning. Their first children’s book, due out August 2020, is being published by Scholastic. They also have four acclaimed CDs under their belts.For more information and music, please visit them on the web.
ENLYRICS: Listen to the clave, I’ll teach it to you.I’ll show you the clave, it’s easy to do.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!Now you know the clave, you can sing it, too.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!Play the clave with your hands, play the clave while you dance.clap, clap, CLAP, CLAP, CLAP!clap, clap, CLAP, CLAP, CLAP!Play the clave with your feet. Play the clave, feel the beat.stomp, stomp, STOMP, STOMP, STOMP!stomp, stomp, STOMP, STOMP, STOMP!Play the clave with your body. Play the clave, join the party!Ok, ok, everybody, listen up! It’s time to get creative. Go get a mug and a fork.Let’s do the clave!With a mug and a fork, play the clave, make it work.Now you know the clave, which is the key to Salsa.The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.Now you know the clave my friend, sing it with me.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! pa, pa, PA, PA, PA!The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.In San Juan, in Havana, play the clave Juana la Igauana.The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.In Cali, Colombia, and in Lima, Peru, play the clave... you sing!The clave is the key to Salsa, you see.pa, pa, PA, PA, PA! (4X)Clave, one, two, three!

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Moona Luna is the kindie group that the New York Daily News says is providing “the missing soundtrack for bilingual/bicultural kids.” After making a splash on the family music scene with their accordion-driven, Latin-inspired debut album Piñata Party (2011), Moona Luna delivered something fresh in its sophomore album Vamos, Let’s Go! (2013), by taking inspiration from American pop hits of the ’50s and ’60s. Staying true to their bilingual mission, their third album P A N O R A M A (2016) celebrated their Latin roots and drew on broader musical influences from the African diaspora. Moona Luna has performed all over the country, from the National Mall in Washington, DC, to the Ordway Center for the Performing Arts in Minnesota, to Madison Square Park in New York City. Their fourth studio album is set to be released in 2020.  For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

TITLE: The Four Seasons

ESLYRICS: En septiembre, el cielo es azul.En octubre, las hojas cambian color.En noviembre, me pongo a hornear.Así es el otoño.En diciembre, brillan lucecitas.En enero, juego en mi casita.Ya en febrero, he sobrevivido.Así es el invierno.En marzo y abril y en mayola primavera trae el sol y ya no se va a ningún lado.En junio, sale la escuela.En julio, estoy en la arena.En agosto, estoy relajada.Por eso me encanta el verano.Por eso me encanta el verano.Por eso me encanta el verano.

ESLYRICS: Toma una fruta. Ábrela por la mitad, y adentro, encontrarás una semilla.Tomamos esa semilla y la sembramos en el suelo.Tomo una semilla. Las siembro en el suelo. Y todo este bosque salió de una sola semilla. Eso es lo que puedes hacer ¡con una semilla!

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Ladies and Gentlestems, bulbs and girls, it’s time to shake your stems, do the jumping bean, and twist and sprout with the freshest bunch in town! The Vegetable Plot is an award-winning musical group for kids and families that has been spreading its funky roots all over the world.  Serving up a big, wriggling heap of catchy tunes, colorful characters, quizzes, dances, jokes, and vegetable-related puns, this soilful bunch will plant melodies in your head that will blossom for years to come. Created by award-winning songwriter and storyteller Luke Escombe (aka Aspara Gus), The Vegetable Plot burst onto the Australian music scene in 2014, winning the prize for best kids’ show at the Sydney Fringe. Since then the project has become a hotbed for some of the tastiest homegrown talent in Australia, including folk group All Our Exes Live in Texas and singing sensation Alice Terry, making them a band that adults can enjoy just as much as kids. In fact, some of The Vegetable Plot's biggest fans admit to listening even when the little ones aren't around. After four years in the soil, the band's long-awaited second album, Season Two, emerged at the end of 2019. Broc-full of songs about vegetables, bedtime routines, more vegetables, community gardens, farmer's markets, yet more vegetables, urban living, alien worlds, the cycles of life, herbs and spices, and all the essential vegetables you'll need for the holidays (including TWO songs about pumpkins), Season Two has taken the group to new heights, securing them a deal with ABC Kids and a recent support slot with The Wiggles.  So come and join Aspara Gus, Ru Barb, Sir Paul McCarrotney, and friends as they take you deep underground for a ride on the soil train and show you exactly why families across the world are embracing these funky food revolutionaries and their mission of love and peas.  For more information and music like this, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Sara Quintanar of Music With Sara is a California-based bilingual children’s musician, educator, and proud mother of three bilingual children. Her songs are celebrated worldwide for their sweet and simple lyrics, lovely melodies, and cultural flair. Sara has released six albums for children and continues to write and teach music in Spanish. Making music a part of a child’s everyday life is something Sara loves to do. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Moona Luna is the kindie group that the New York Daily News says is providing “the missing soundtrack for bilingual/bicultural kids.” After making a splash on the family music scene with their accordion-driven, Latin-inspired debut album Piñata Party (2011), Moona Luna delivered something fresh in its sophomore album Vamos, Let’s Go! (2013), by taking inspiration from American pop hits of the ’50s and ’60s. Staying true to their bilingual mission, their third album P A N O R A M A (2016) celebrated their Latin roots and drew on broader musical influences from the African diaspora. Moona Luna has performed all over the country, from the National Mall in Washington, DC, to the Ordway Center for the Performing Arts in Minnesota, to Madison Square Park in New York City. Their fourth studio album is set to be released in 2020.  For more information and music, please visit them on the web.

SongAuthorsBIOTEXT: Inspirational and genuine, Divinity Roxx has earned the reputation of irrefutable front woman of her own genre-bursting and compelling musical journey. Her career as a bass player skyrocketed after attending a bass camp led by the legendary Victor Wooten, where she was invited to tour with him three months after the camp. After touring with Victor for five years, she became the bass player and assistant musical director for Beyoncé. She was given a featured solo by the artist on The Beyoncé Experience and I Am… Sasha Fierce tours and DVDs. She also composed original music for the I Am… Sasha Fierce tour and DVD. Divinity has appeared on countless television shows, including the Grammys, Saturday Night Live, Good Morning America, The Arsenio Hall Show, Ellen, and The American Music Awards, with personal highlights including a special performance at the White House and an appearance on the hit TV show Soul Man. She is the current bass player in the Black Girls Rock Orchestra, which airs on BET, and is the touring bassist and Musical Director for the powerhouse singer and performer Fantasia. Despite her appearances with so many legendary and iconic figures, it is in her solo performance that Divinity shines brightest. She combines virtuosic bass playing with an eclectic mashup of hip-hop, rock, and funk that she calls “Alternative Soul.” Her passion for composition, combined with her lyrical prowess and electrifying stage presence, captivates audiences worldwide. Her 2016 release ImPossible received critical acclaim and earned her an Independent Music Award for Best Spoken Word Album, further highlighting the depth of her lyrical aptitude. The album features the Keith Harris- produced song “We Are,” inspired by her former poetry professor, the late, great June Jordan. The album also features an appearance by her mentor and five-time Grammy-Award-winning artist Victor Wooten. She is currently performing, teaching, and writing multiple projects, including a new album, a stage play, and a series of children’s books and music. For more information and music, please visit her on the web.
